result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Brown

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:16 PM - cases called - 22CF127 and 22CF138.  Defendant David Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by video for David Brown.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Ellis.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  No cross by Atty Fehrenbach.  No argument by counsel.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - in receipt of the Information but requesting a reserve wavier hearing.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:38 PM - cases called - 22CF127 and 22CF138.  Defendant David Brown appeared by video, in custody from Lincoln Hills School.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by video for David Brown.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing hat wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond in 22CF138.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with Victims 1, 2 or 3 once released from Lincoln Hills.  No violent or abusive contact with Victims 1, 2 or 3 while housed at Lincoln Hills.  No contact with the co-defendant - Da'Mani Jackson - except for incidental contact while housed at Lincoln Hills.  Not to discuss this matter with the co-defendant - Da'Mani Jackson.

1:40 PM - case called.  Defendant David Brown appeared by video, in custody from Lincoln Hills.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
